I added lines containing the held locks to each call and am pretty sure the ** marked ones are causing the deadlock.

During `(*RWFileHandle).Flush` the file tries to add itself to it's directory using `(*Dir).addObject` which tries to acquire `d.mu.Lock()` while holding `f.mu.Lock()`.
Concurrently `(*Dir).ReadDirAll` tries to set the file object with `(*File).setObjectNoUpdate` which acquires `f.mu.Lock()` while holding `d.mu.Lock()`.

So `poll-interval` only increases the chance of this happening by invalidating the cache with `(*Dir).ForgetPath`.

The best solution is probably to disable `(*File).setObjectNoUpdate` while the `RWFileHandle` is being closed, as it would be possible to override the uploaded object with a old version during `(*Dir).ReadDirAll` otherwise.

I've worked around them by narrowing the locking so the file lock and the directory lock don't overlap in File.setObject and File.Remove.  I think that is OK but I'm not 100% sure!

I'd really appreciate a review of this @B4dM4n if you have time :-) 5cc92ab0f383e9780cc995caa331c5f287c11cfd I think your analysis is spot on - it agrees 100% with mine.  I chose a different solution though - what do you think of that?  Note that `f.d` is read only and hence doesn't need to be protected with the mutex.

@darthShadow here is a beta for you to try

https://beta.rclone.org/branch/v1.45-021-g5cc92ab0-fix-2811-deadlock-beta/ (uploaded in 15-30 mins)


### deadlock 1

```
ReadWrite.Close()
-> file.Flush
-> file.setObject()
   -> f.mu.Lock
     -> d.addObject
         -> d.mu.Lock (DEADLOCK)

Dir.ReadDirAll()
-> d.mu.Lock
  -> _readDir
  -> _readDirFromEntries
  -> file.setObjectNoUpdate
      -> f.mu.Lock (DEADLOCK)

ChangeNotify
-> ForgetPath
  -> dir.mu.Lock (DEADLOCK)
```

### deadlock 2

```
Dir.Remove
-> file.Remove
   -> f.mu.Lock
   -> file.delObject()
     -> d.mu.Lock (DEADLOCK)

Dir.Lookup
Dir.Stat
dir.stat
-> d.mu.Lock
  -> _readDir
  -> _readDirFromEntries
  -> file.setObjectNoUpdate
      -> f.mu.Lock (DEADLOCK)

ChangeNotify
-> ForgetPath
  -> dir.mu.Lock (DEADLOCK)
```
@ncw Did something fail in the build? I don't see builds for any system other than Windows.

@darthShadow I've fixed the build (hopefully!) here:

https://beta.rclone.org/branch/v1.45-022-g86ed4e32-fix-2811-deadlock-beta/ (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

issue.title: Multithread with rclone mount?

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
I'm using latest rclone to work with dropbox
The problem is that when one process runs copying of big file another process can't read directories/files.
I there any way to increase threads so it can do multiple uploads/downloads at same time?

body:
I've merged this fix to [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org) now it will be in v1.46

I also made a test program for hunting down deadlocks... (`vfs/test_vfs`)

I believe I'm suffering from deadlocks when using the rclone cache against a glusterfs remote with very low latency.

How can I debug it? The logs at INFO don't log anything, and this happen randomly...a debug log would be >10gb for sure

The rclone mount is read-only, I add stuff to glusterfs then refresh rclone with vfs/refresh.  Do you still think I should use modify window?

I'll try killing rclone next time this happens...but rclone keeps working when this happens...what actually happens is that the php scripts accessing the mount get stuck in "D" state and eventually the kernel logs it with hung_task_timeout.

> The rclone mount is read-only, I add stuff to glusterfs then refresh rclone with vfs/refresh. Do you still think I should use modify window?

I don't know... Hold off on that until we have a backtrace

> I'll try killing rclone next time this happens...but rclone keeps working when this happens...what actually happens is that the php scripts accessing the mount get stuck in "D" state and eventually the kernel logs it with hung_task_timeout.

That sounds very much like a deadlock. I'll need to know exactly which rclone version you are running in the bugreport too!
